dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 4194 EAS: Government Reports Elimination Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

engrossed-amendment-form.current-chamber: In the Senate of the United States,

section.text: That the bill from the House of Representatives (H.R. 4194) entitled An Act to provide for the elimination or modification of Federal reporting requirements., do pass with the following

amendment-instruction.text: In lieu of the matter proposed to be inserted, insert the following:

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Government Reports Elimination Act of 2014.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: TITLE III—Corporation for National and Community Service
Sec. 501. Report on Impact Aid construction justifying discretionary grant awards eliminated.
Sec. 701. Great Lakes management comprehensive report eliminated.
TITLE VIII—Executive Office of the President
Sec. 801. Report relating to waiver of certain sanctions against North Korea eliminated.
TITLE XIII—Office of the Director of National Intelligence

subsection.header: Peanut base acres data collection and publication
subsection.text: Section 1302(d) of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 8752(d)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking paragraph (3);
in paragraph (4), by striking Paragraphs (1) through (3) and inserting Paragraphs (1) and (2); and
by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (3).

by striking paragraph (2).

subsection.text: Section 212 of the Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Convention Act of 1995 (16 U.S.C. 5611) is repealed.

title.header: Corporation for National and Community Service

subsection.text: The National and Community Service Act of 1990 is amended by repealing part IV of subtitle B of title I (42 U.S.C. 12565).

subsection.header: Help America Vote Act Funds audit

paragraph.text: Section 902(b) of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 (42 U.S.C. 15542(b)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking paragraph (5) and inserting paragraph (4);
by redesignating paragraphs (4) through (6) as paragraphs (3) through (5).

paragraph.header: Preservation of authority to recoup funds resulting from prior audits
paragraph.text: Section 902(c) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 15542(c)) is amended by inserting after subsection (b) the following: prior to the date of the enactment of the Government Reports Elimination Act of 2014.

subsection.header: State Small Business Credit Initiative audit and report
subsection.text: Section 3011 of the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5710) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (b); and
by redesignating subsections (c) and (d) as subsections (b) and (c), respectively.

subsection.header: Small Business Lending Fund Program audit and report
subsection.text: Section 4107 of the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 4741 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (c); and
by redesignating subsections (d) and (e) as subsections (c) and (d), respectively.

subsection.header: Housing Assistance Council financial statement audit report
subsection.text: Section 6303(a) of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (42 U.S.C. 1490e note) is amended by striking paragraph (3).

subsection.header: National Prevention, Health Promotion and Public Health Council
subsection.text: Subsection (i) of section 4001 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (42 U.S.C. 300u–10) is amended by striking The Secretary and the Comptroller General of the United States shall jointly conduct periodic reviews and inserting The Secretary shall conduct periodic reviews.

subsection.header: Postcard mandate
subsection.text: Section 719(g)(2) of title 31, United States Code is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking the first sentence and inserting the following: The Comptroller General shall make each list available through the public website of the Government Accountability Office.; and
in the second sentence, by inserting of Congress after committee or member.

subsection.header: Annual audit of the Congressional Award Foundation

paragraph.header: Use of private independent public accountant
paragraph.text: Section 107 of the Congressional Award Act (2 U.S.C. 807) is amended to read as follows:

subsection.header: Contracts with independent public accountant
subsection.text: The Board shall enter into a contract with an independent public accountant to conduct an annual audit in accordance with generally accepted government auditing standards, of the financial records of the Board and of any corporation established under section 106(i), and shall ensure that the independent public accountant has access for the purpose of the audit to any books, documents, papers, and records of the Board or such corporation (or any agent of the Board or such corporation) which the independent public accountant reasonably determines to be pertinent to the Congressional Award Program.

subsection.header: Annual report to Congress on audit results
subsection.text: Not later than May 15 of each calendar year, the Board shall submit to appropriate officers, committees, and subcommittees of Congress and to the Comptroller General of the United States a report on the results of the most recent audit conducted pursuant to this section, and shall include in the report information on any such additional areas as the independent public accountant who conducted the audit determines deserve or require evaluation.

subsection.header: Review by the Comptroller General of annual audit

paragraph.text: The Comptroller General of the United States shall review each annual audit conducted under subsection (a).

For purposes of a review under paragraph (1), the Comptroller General, or any duly authorized representative of the Comptroller General, shall have access to any books, documents, papers, and records of the Board or such corporation, or any agent of the Board or such corporation, including the independent external auditor designated under subsection (a), which, in the opinion of the Comptroller General, may be pertinent.

Not later than 180 days after the date on which the Comptroller General receives a report under subsection (b), the Comptroller General shall submit to Congress a report containing the results of the review conducted under paragraph (1) with respect to the preceding year.

paragraph.header: Amendments relating to compliance with fiscal control and accounting policies and procedures
paragraph.text: Section 104(c) of the Congressional Award Act (2 U.S.C. 804(c)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), in the first sentence, by—

clause.text: inserting policies and before procedures; and

in the first sentence, by striking The Comptroller General of the United States and inserting The independent public accountant conducting the annual audit of the financial records of the Board pursuant to section 107(a); and
in the second sentence, by striking the Comptroller General and inserting the independent public accountant.

paragraph.text: The amendments made by this subsection shall take effect on October 1, 2014.

subsection.header: Annual GAO review of proposed HHS recovery threshold
subsection.text: The third sentence of section 1862(b)(9)(B)(i) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395y(b)(9)(B)(i)) is amended by striking for a year and inserting for 2014.

subsection.header: Prohibition on importation of products made with dog or cat fur
subsection.text: Section 308 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1308) is amended by striking subsection (e).

subsection.header: Port of Entry Infrastructure Assessment Study and National Land Border Security Plan
subsection.text: The Border Infrastructure and Technology Modernization Act of 2007 (title VI of division E of Public Law 110–161; 6 U.S.C. 1401 et seq.) is amended by striking sections 603 and 604.

subsection.header: Fees for certain customs services

paragraph.text: Section 13031 of the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 (Public Law 99–272; 19 U.S.C. 58c) is amended—

paragraph.text: Subsection (f) of such section is further amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(B), by striking paragraph (5) and inserting paragraph (4); and
in paragraph (3)(A), by striking paragraph (5) and inserting paragraph (4).

subsection.header: Modernization of National Distress and Response System

paragraph.text: Section 346 of the Maritime Transportation Security Act of 2002 (Public Law 107–295; 14 U.S.C. 88 note) is repealed.
The table of contents in section 1(b) of such Act is amended by striking the item relating to section 346.

section.text: Section 342 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 15902) is amended—

by redesignating subsections (f) through (j) as subsections (e) through (i), respectively.

section.text: Section 207 of the Andean Trade Preference Act (19 U.S.C. 3205) is repealed.

title.header: Office of the Director of National Intelligence

section.text: Section 2(5)(E) of the Senate resolution advising and consenting to ratification of the Document Agreed Among the States Parties to the Treaty on Conventional Armed Forces in Europe (CFE) of November 19, 1990, adopted at Vienna May 31, 1996 (Treaty Doc. 105–5) (commonly referred to as the CFE Flank Document), 105th Congress, agreed to May 14, 1997, is repealed.
Section 620F of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (22 U.S.C. 2376) is amended by striking subsection (c).

subsection.header: Reports of Air Traffic Services Committee

by redesignating subparagraph (I) as subparagraph (H).

subsection.header: Annual summaries of airport financial reports

paragraph.text: Section 47107 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking subsection (k).

subparagraph.text: Section 47107 of title 49, United States Code, as amended by paragraph (1), is further amended—

clause.text: by redesignating subsections (l) through (t) as subsections (k) through (s), respectively;
in paragraph (5) of subsection (k), as redesignated by clause (i)—

subclause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking subsection (n)(7) and inserting subsection (m)(7); and
in subparagraph (B), by striking subsection (n) and inserting subsection (m);
by striking subsections (b) and (l) each place it appears and inserting subsections (b) and (k); and
by striking subsection (o) each place it appears and inserting subsection (n);

clause.text: in subsection (n), as so redesignated, by striking subsection (n) each place it appears and inserting subsection (m);
in subsection (o), as so redesignated, by striking subsection (o) and inserting subsection (n);
in subsection (p), as so redesignated, by striking subsections (a) through (p) and inserting subsections (a) through (o); and
in subsection (q), as so redesignated, by striking subsections (q)(1) through (3) and inserting paragraphs (1) through (3) of subsection (p).

subparagraph.text: Section 46301(d)(2) of such title is amended by striking section 47107(l) and inserting section 47107(k).
Section 47111(e) of such title is amended by striking section 47107(l) and inserting section 47107(k).
Section 9502 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking section 47107(n) each place it appears and inserting section 47107(m).
